quest.name: A Fistful of Resolve
journal: Professor Erik eyes you with a look of self-satisfaction.

Greeting you with his customary condescension, Professor Erik informs you that Widargelt is troubled by some matter or other. The professor has been unable to prise the details out of the tight-lipped monk, but he believes that you will fare better. Make your way to Revenant's Toll, where Widargelt is based, and make yourself available to your brother-in-arms.

As the professor predicts, Widargelt readily reveals to you his woes. The Ala Mhigan Resistance has invited him to rejoin the cause, and though he is resolved to turn down the offer, the event has set him to thinking about his purpose─what he can do in aid of his beleaguered homeland. O'tchakha and D'zentsa ask that you keep an eye on their master as he goes to meet with the Resistance representative in Little Ala Mhigo.

You arrive in time to witness Widargelt giving Gundobald his answer. Though the old soldier expresses his understanding, saying that fighting is not the only way to serve one's nation, his words leave Widargelt wondering about his own path. Wishing to be alone, he takes his leave and heads for an unknown location. Find him and offer him your support.

You find Widargelt in contemplation before the mark of the Destroyer. As he relates to you how the Fist of Rhalgr, once the foremost faith among Ala Mhigans, has all but died out in his homeland, the monk finally realizes what he must do. He bids you return with him to Revenant's Toll, where he will share his plans with everyone.

Before his gathered friends and pupils, Widargelt reveals that he means to go to Gyr Abania on a mission to revive the Fist of Rhalgr. O'tchakha, D'zentsa, and the professor offer to accompany him, and naturally so do you. Overwhelmed by the support, Widargelt expresses his gratitude and determination, and bids you see to your preparations.

※The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 63.
objectives: Speak with Widargelt at Revenant's Toll.
Speak with Widargelt in Little Ala Mhigo.
Speak with Widargelt at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! Dim though you are, I would swear you possess an innate ability to sense when you are needed. And on that note, I have a task for you.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Your fellow brute Widargelt─some matter or other weighs heavily on his mind of late. Knowing him, it can only pertain to Ala Mhigo, but the stubborn oaf is determined to keep it pent-up inside. Loath to trouble me with it or some such nonsense, I shouldn't doubt.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But you, my friend─you are as a sisterbrother to him. If there is a womanman alive in whom he would be willing to confide, it is you. For the hopeless idiot's sake, I bid you go to Revenant's Toll and place yourself at his disposal.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Good. That will be all for today. You have done well. I am pleased with your progress.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: You always say that, Master. But we're nowhere near where we want to be. Not even close.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Indeed. And besides, any progress we make, we owe wholly to you.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Damn right. Without your guidance, we'd be goin' nowhere fast.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: My guidance...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename, I am glad to see you. Things are well here, as you can see. But...hmmm...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha, you may go ahead. I would speak with Forename.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Those two grow stronger every day. Shadows darken their way no more. Their purpose is clear.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Would that I could say the same of mine...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You see, I have received an offer. The Resistance. They ask that I rejoin them. Lead one of their units.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Once, I would have jumped at the chance. But no more. No longer do I live for revenge. You and the professor showed me it is not the way.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: So I will turn down the offer. I would focus not on fighting, but rebuilding. But what is within my power? Beyond the battlefield, how can I serve my homeland?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forgive me. I should not trouble you with this. It is my answer to find.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But first, I will give the Resistance their answer. My thanks for listening, Forename.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: He still agonizes over it...

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Aye, hardly the state of mind to be in for such an important meeting. Isn't there anything we can do?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Not us two─his pride will not allow it. But you, Forename─he opened up to you just now, did he not? I daresay he will do so again. We're terribly sorry to impose, but could you please follow Master Widargelt? Watch over him in our stead?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Will you watch over Widargelt?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: For you, O'tchakha? Of course.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: For you, D'zentsa? Of course.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Hehe! We are in your debt, Forename!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Wait, what? Who, me?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Um, Forename? Do you, er...reckon you could look in on Master Widargelt for us?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: He is bound for Little Ala Mhigo, I believe.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I doubt not that Widargelt is in good hands. After all, who should know a brute better than a fellow brute?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You would bear witness to my resolve? Very well, sisterbrother. Witness me.

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Have you made up your mind, then?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I have. Your offer does me great honor. But with respect I must decline. My days of vengeance are over.

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: I see. That is your decision, and I shan't press you further. Yet I would be lying were I to say I'm not disappointed. With your mastery of the Fist, your contribution to our struggle would have been immeasurable.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I am sorry...

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Do not be. Remember, fighting is not the only way to serve one's nation. We each of us must find our own path to walk.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Our own path...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: There is a place I would be. I take my leave of you.

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: 'Tis plain you know Widargelt better than most. If you are indeed his friend, as I mark you to be, I needn't tell you to be there for him.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: To find me here... You know me too well, Forename.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The mark of the Destroyer. My people bore it here when the Empire came. The risk was great. But their faith was greater still.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Alas, that faith has all but faded. Wiped away from the motherland. The Garleans suffer not the divine. They allow us not even the solace of worship.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: ...By Rhalgr, I know now. That which I can do for Ala Mhigo. All along, there was but the one path.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Let us return to Revenant's Toll. There I will tell all.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Thank you all for coming. I have found my calling. And I would share it with you.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I will go to Gyr Abania. And there revive the Fist of Rhalgr.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Well then, we're coming with you. We won't let you out of our sight─not until we've repaid the debt, at any rate.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Suffice to say I too shall come. The lands of Gyr Abania harbor countless mysteries, and such knowledge as I possess will doubtless serve you in your endeavor.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: And you, sisterbrother. Can I count on you as well?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'm with you all the way!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'm not feeling up to it.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Wh-What!? But Forename, it would be unthinkable without you! Please reconsider!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I am glad. Your presence gives me heart. The mission will not be easy. But I will not rest until I succeed. And the Fist of Rhalgr is returned to the land. This I swear.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text:
On that inspiring note, I shall go and make ready.
...And Widargelt─pray do not forget what we discussed.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We will depart anon. Pray see to your preparations, Forename.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 63.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Glad to see Master worked things out.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: With your help, Master Widargelt has found his path. Thank you, Forename.
